N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2208.4 - Service requirement

State Regulations

The recipient's service obligation under an award shall be
for a period of 24 months. Such service obligation shall consist of either the
establishment of a practice of medicine or employment as a licensed physician
in the designated shortage area in New York State, or a combination of both. Such practice or employment shall provide full-time direct patient care to the
residents of the shortage area. Only periods of service occurring after the
receipt of an award payment shall be counted toward fulfillment of the service
requirement. Should it be necessary for the recipient to interrupt his or her
practice of medicine or employment as a licensed physician, the recipient may
apply to the president for a leave of absence. Such application shall be in
such form as the president may prescribe and shall state the period for which
such leave is requested and the reasons for such leave. The granting of any
leave shall be in the sole judgment and discretion of the
president. Notes
